title: Looking for a free alternative for Trinité No. 2
content:
Can anyone recommend a free alternative for TriniteNo2 ( [http://www.fontplus.net/fontes/buscar/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071224115512/http:/www.fontplus.net/fontes/buscar/ "http://www.fontplus.net/fontes/buscar/"))?

 [‹ Languages at a glance](http://web.archive.org/web/20071224115512/http:/typophile.com/node/31399 "Go to previous forum topic") [type t-shirts for the entire family? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071224115512/http:/typophile.com/node/38246 "Go to next forum topic")
author: frankw

comments.content: How <cite>alternative</cite> do you wanna go? There is no 100% equivalent to a top class font for free, and I doubt there is a 90% one, whatever that might be. You might wanna read [The value of type](http://web.archive.org/web/20071224115512/http:/letterror.com/content/value/index.html) by Erik van Blokland and the [FAQ on Free Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20071224115512/http:/typophile.com/node/14652).

\> _a free alternative for Trinite No. 2_

You’re kidding, right? This is like asking for a budget Rolls Royce. Sure, you can find a cheaper car, but the only resemblance will be that it also has four wheels and a steering wheel. You want a free alternative for Trinité No. 2? You will find a serif face that has an ’a’ and a ’b’ and a ’c’ and so on, but that’ll be the only thing similar.

If you need free fonts, there definitely is no room to be picky. Just use whatever you can find.

A free alternative to Trinité does not exist, as stated, but I think [Dolly](http://web.archive.org/web/20071224115512/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3?id1=dolly&id2=overview) could be an excellent and relatively cheap alternative for it.
